Description: Fragment of papyrus with finely drawn red and black vignette from the Amduat; the preserved portion shows the lower register of the 11th hour in which goddesses, one with lioness-head, execute the evil dead in firepits before Horus. Mounted in one frame with 75027-30.
Excavator/field collector: Field Collection by: William John Bankes
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (381147) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/381147)
Taylor et al 2011 / The history and conservation of the papyrus of Tuy (p.98)
Condition: Papyrus Survey: Condition Details: Papyrus: loss Black ink Red ink Mount Details: Sandwich: glass Binding: magic tape Binding: self adhesive tape Object Priority: A Mount Priority: A Overall Condition: A Curatorial condition comment: good
